comments.author: Jeff Dever
comments.body:
Need to provide a walkthrough of the API, standard practices tuned for a new user.

Example code is handled under another bug.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body: This looks like what I'm working on, so reassigning to myself.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=4935)
Updated authentication guide and rearranged side menu to pave the way for the extra documentation to be added.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Please don't redeploy the site just yet (commiting the files is optional) as I 
need to create a few more files to satisfy the index yet.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=4991)
Latest user docs.  Includes a simple getting started tutorial.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=5226)
Latest revision of docs.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
I've attached the latest revision of docs for review, this is now very nearly 
complete, with just the character encoding guide to be added.  Links have been 
checked with the maven link-check plugin but the docs haven't been fully proof 
read yet.

comments.author: Michael Becke
comments.body:
This looks good. Nice work! I think it's probably time to commit this so we can
go through it and fix the little things (typos, etc).  I will go ahead and
commit this tonight unless I hear some objections.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Just one objection, you should use the latest version that I'm about to 
attach. :)  It includes the final document for this installment the character 
encodings tutorial.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=5236)
Latest version with all documents completed.  Note a patch file is included in the zip.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=6529)
Cookie configuration guide.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=6530)
Corrections to troubleshooting.xml and adds cookie guide to the menu.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
I've attached a new Cookie guide with some simple information about cookie
management in HttpClient.  It would be good if someone more familiar with
Cookies could review it at some point.

Also attached is a patch to troubleshooting.xml to tell people to always include
the wire trace log (as opposed to if they think it's useful).  The patch also
adds the cookie guide to navigation.xml.

comments.author: Michael Becke
comments.body:
The cookie docs and the updated troubleshooting have been committed.  I love "Specifying the 
Specification" :)

Mike

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=6599)
Cookies guide minor corrections

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Folks, I have finally started working on the SSL guide. Meanwhile, could you
please take a look at those correction I have made to the Cookie guide? There
are some factual discrepancies in it. Since the Cookie guide has already been
deployed at the HttpClient site, we should not wait too long with its revision
and update. 

Oleg

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Oleg,
Changes to the cookie spec look good to me.  Thanks for checking that over.  We should definitely 
commit and redeply the website as soon as it's next convienient.  There are now a few changes 
waiting to be deployed.

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Thanks, Adrian. Patch committed. 

Welcome to the Fellowship, by the way

Oleg

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=6644)
SSL Guide (take 1)

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Adrian, please find the first draft of the SSL guide attached above. It's still
quite raw but it should be good enough so you could take it over. If you need
additional input please let me know

Oleg.

comments.author: Michael Becke
comments.body:
Oleg,

This looks like a good start.  The only major thing I noticed is in regard to
JCE.  JCE is not required to use SSL with HttpClient.  I belive JCE is only used
by NTLM.

Mike

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Ok, point taken. I'll make the corrections required. Any other comments?

Oleg

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=6682)
SSL Guide (take 2)

comments.author: Michael Becke
comments.body: SSL Guide committed.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
Created an attachment (id=6775)
Patch to SSL guide to clean things up a little.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
As promised, I've attached a patch that cleans up the SSL docs a little - no changes to the 
conceptual meaning.  If noone objects I'll commit the changes in the morning.

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Looks good to me. Go ahead and commit the patch

Oleg

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body: Patch committed.

comments.author: Adrian Sutton
comments.body:
I think this bug can be closed now and individual bugs opened for any further 
docs.  There's starting to be too much information here on too many different 
topics to keep track of.

description:
Provide more example code in CVS and give a clear link on the website.  A
walkthrough of the API.  Documenntation suitable for new users.
